reference.shortdesc: A component is a part or element of a larger whole, for example, a machine, software application, or vehicle.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: A product might be made up of many components, each of which is installable separately. Components might also be shared by several products so that the same component is available for installation with many products.

An implementation might use this identification to check cross-component dependencies when some (but not all) components are installed. An implementation might use the identification to make sure that topics are hidden, removed, or flagged in some way when the component they describe is not installed.
